newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk military chief warns Islamists on secularism.
newsitem.headline: Turk military chief warns Islamists on secularism.

text.p: The head of Turkey's powerful military has warned Islamists against trying to water down the country's strict secularist system, Anatolian news agency said on Tuesday.

"The goal is to change the secularist, democratic system and drag the country into the darkness of the Middle Ages," the state-run agency quoted General Ismail Hakki Karadayi as telling a magazine for Turks living in Western Europe.
"This cannot be accepted by the Turkish people and their armed forces," he said.
Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan, NATO member Turkey's first Islamist prime minister, has generally avoided upsetting the staunchly secularist military since he came to power in June.

But some members of his Welfare Party have publicly called for introducing more Moslem practices into public life. The Welfare-run justice ministry is trying to lift a ban on women civil servants wearing Islamic headscarves to work.
Political analysts say the military is uncomfortable at Erbakan's efforts to have closer cooperation with Moslem countries and possible defence industry cooperation with Iran.
